thread.title: Primavera defeated (4-1) in Poland. Youth League, Legia scores four. Viola blackout for 12 minutes.
thread.title_full: Primavera defeated (4-1) in Poland. Youth League, Legia scores four. Viola blackout for 12 minutes.

author: Quotidiano Sportivo
title: Primavera defeated (4-1) in Poland. Youth League, Legia scores four. Viola blackout for 12 minutes.
text:
Primavera defeated (4-1) in Poland. Youth League, Legia scores four. Viola blackout for 12 minutes. It was a debut to forget for the Primavera in the Youth League, with the Viola Under-20s losing in the first leg of the second round of the "champions' path"... di ANDREA GIANNATTASIO October 23, 2025 The Maratona tower that stands out over the Artemio Franchi stadium in Florence
It was a debut to forget for the Primavera Youth League, with the Viola Under-20 team losing 4-1 in Poland to Legia Warsaw in the first leg of the second round of the tournament's "champions path." Despite a solid performance, Galloppa's team paid dearly for numerous starters missing—including Braschi, Balbo, Kospo, Deli, Jallow, and Koné—and the hosts' greater physicality. Yet the match had started well for the Tuscans, who were also forced to adapt to three players out of position: after just 40 seconds, Mazzeo had put them ahead, but Legia turned the tide in the first half, scoring three times in just 12 minutes through Mizera, Pchelka, and Kovacik. In the second half, Kovacik sealed the victory with a goal to make it 4-1. The match, however, was more balanced than the scoreline suggests. The return leg is scheduled for November 5th at Viola Park: it will be there that Fiorentina will have to try to accomplish a feat to advance to the next round.
A. Gian.
